unit_name: Introduction to data science and artificial intelligence
description: Data lifecycle, business processes, data collection & cleaning, management, analysis, tools & ethics
Programming fundamentals, SDLC, APIs, control structures, methods & modularity, classes & inheritance, multi-class applications
Software engineering fundamentals, SDLC, methodologies (Waterfall, Agile, Scrum), programming intro, team collaboration, ethics, human-centric design
Object-oriented programming, mobile app development, language syntax, design, coding, and implementation.
Software process management, teamwork, project organisation, risk management, ethics, and process evaluation.
Cryptography, authentication, access control, system security, vulnerabilities, threat protection, and cybersecurity trends.
Programming paradigms, language design, type systems, functional and declarative programming, polymorphism, evaluation models, and modern language applications.
Object-oriented design, principles, implementation, modelling, and software quality.
Software quality assurance, testing techniques, automation, code review, reliability, and quality analysis.
Operating system structure, C programming, process management, scheduling, memory, synchronization, and file systems.
Statistical modelling, data collection, probability distributions, hypothesis testing, regression, Bayesian methods, and model evaluation.
Data warehousing, OLAP, data integration, storage, processing, and analytical system design.
Deep learning, neural networks, computer vision, NLP, transformers, generative AI, and practical applications.
Data engineering, big data, parallel processing, NoSQL, unstructured data, and data streaming.
AI security, cyber threats, defensive strategies, deepfakes, forensics, and adversarial technologies.
Software architecture, design principles, best practices, modelling, and application contexts.
Artificial intelligence, search, knowledge representation, reasoning, machine learning, planning, and ethics.
Technopreneurship, innovation, startups, business models, market strategy, and venture development.
Parallel computing, concurrency, multithreading, distributed systems, algorithms, and programming paradigms.
Machine learning, statistical models, regression, classification, clustering, neural networks, and model evaluation.
Computer architecture, logic design, memory systems, instruction processing, and processor architectures.
Advanced algorithms, data structures, problem solving, analysis, optimization, and algorithmic paradigms.
